arabicText: وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْمَشْرِقُ وَٱلْمَغْرِبُ ۚ فَأَيْنَمَا تُوَلُّوا۟ فَثَمَّ وَجْهُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ وَٰسِعٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 East	 and	 the	West,	 all	 belong	 to	
Allah - so	 whichever	 direction	 you	 face,	
there	 is	 Allah’s	 Entity	 (Allah’s	 Mercy	 is	
directed	 towards	you);	indeed	Allah is	 the	
All	 Capable,	 (His	 powers	 and	 reach	 are	
limitless),	the	All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 poorab	 pachchim	 (Mashriq	 wa	
Maghrib)	sab	Allah	hi	ka	hai	to	tum	jidhar	
mooñh	 karo	 udhar	 Wajhullah	 (khuda	 ki	
rahmat	tumhāri	taraf	mutawajjeh)	hai	beshak	Allah	wus'at	wāla	ilm	wāl

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًۭا ۗ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۖ بَل لَّهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ كُلٌّۭ لَّهُۥ قَـٰنِتُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 said,	 “Allah has	 taken	 an	
offspring	 for	 Himself”	- Purity	 is	 to	 Him!	
In	 fact,	 all	 that	is	in	 the	 heavens	 and	 the	
earth,	is	His	dominion;	all	are	submissive	
to	Him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bole	 khuda	 ne	 apne	 liye	 aulād	 rakhi	
pāki	hai	usey	balke	usi	ki	milk	hai	jo	kuch
āsmanoñ	 aur	 zameen	 me	 hai	 sab	 uske	
huzoor	gardan	dāle	haiñ

arabicText: بَدِيعُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًۭا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
englishTranslationText:
The	 Originator	 of	 the	 heavens	 and	 the	
earth	- and	when	He	commands	a	thing,	He	only	says	to	it,	“Be",	and	it	thereupon	happens
romanUrduTranslationText:
Naya	 paida	 karne	 wāla	 āsmanoñ	 aur	
zameen	ka	aur	jab	kisi	bāt	ka	hukm	farmāye	to	us	se	yahi	farmāta	hai	ke	ho	ja	wo	fauran	ho	jāti	
hai

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ لَوْلَا يُكَلِّمُنَا ٱللَّهُ أَوْ تَأْتِينَآ ءَايَةٌۭ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّثْلَ قَوْلِهِمْ ۘ تَشَـٰبَهَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لِقَوْمٍۢ يُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	ignorant	people	said,	“Why	does	not	Allah speak	to	us,	or	some	sign	come	to	us?”	Those	
before	 them	had	also	spoken	in	 the	same	way	as	 they	speak;	 their	hearts	(and	of	 those	before	
them)	are	all	alike;	undoubtedly,	We	have	made	the	signs	clear	for	the	people	who	have	faith.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jahil	bole	Allah	ham	se	kiyuñ	nahi	kalām	karta	ya	hameiñ	koi	nishāni	mile	un	se	agloñ	ne	
bhi	aisi	hi	kahi	unki	si	bāt	inke	unke	dil	ek	se	haiñ	beshak	ham	ne	nishāniyāñ	khol	di’ñ yaqeen	
wāloñ	ke	liye

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ بَشِيرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا ۖ وَلَا تُسْـَٔلُ عَنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
Undoubtedly,	We	 have	 sent	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	
him)	with	the	truth,	giving	glad	tidings	and	conveying	warning,	and	you	will	not	be	questioned	
about	the	people	of	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Beshak	Ham	ne	tumheiñ	haq	ke	sāth	bheja	khush	khabri	deta	aur	dar	sunāta	aur	tum	se	dozakh	
waloñ	ka	suwāl	na	hoga

arabicText: وَلَن تَرْضَىٰ عَنكَ ٱلْيَهُودُ وَلَا ٱلنَّصَـٰرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ تَتَّبِعَ مِلَّتَهُمْ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ هُدَى ٱللَّهِ هُوَ ٱلْهُدَىٰ ۗ وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَآءَهُم بَعْدَ ٱلَّذِى جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۙ مَا لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِىٍّۢ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	never	will	the	Jews	or	the	Christians	be	
pleased	 with	 you,	 until	 you	 follow	 their	
religion;	 say,	 “The	guidance	 of	Allah only	is	
the	 (true)	 guidance”;	 and	 were	 you	 (the	
followers	 of	 this	 Prophet)	 to	 follow	 their	
desires	 after	 the	 knowledge	 has	 come	 to	
you,	you	would	then	not	have	a	protector	or	
aide	against	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hargiz	tumse	Yahūd	aur	Nasāra	rāzi	na	
hoñge	 jab	 tak	 tum	 unke	 deen	 ki	 pairwi	 na	
karo	 tum	 farma	 do	 ke	 Allah	 hi	 ki	 hidāyat	
hidāyat	 hai	 aur (Aey	 sun	 ne	 wale	 Kas-eBashad) agar	tu	unki	khuwahishoñ	ka	pairo	
huwa	bād	iske	ke	tujhe	ilm	ā	chuka	to	Allah	
se	 tera	 koi	 bachāne	 wāla	 na	 hoga	 aur	 na	
madad	gār

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَتْلُونَهُۥ حَقَّ تِلَاوَتِهِۦٓ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۗ وَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 to	 whom	 We	 have	 given	 the	 Book,	
read	it	in	the	manner	it	should	be	read;	it	is	
they	who	believe	in	it;	and	 those	who	deny	
it	- it	is	they	who	are	the	losers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jinheiñ	hum	ne	Kitāb	di	hai	wo	jaisi	chahiye	
uski	 tilāwat	 karte	 haiñ	 wohi	 is	 par	 Imān	
rakhte	haiñ	aur	jo	uske	munkir	hoñ	to	wohi	
ziyān-kār (nuqsān	uthāne	wāle) hain

arabicText: يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتِىَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَأَنِّى فَضَّلْتُكُمْ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
O	Descendants	of	Israel!	Remember	the	favour	
of	Mine	which	I	bestowed	upon	you	and	made	
you superior	 to	 all	 others	 of	 your	 time.	 (By	
sending	Noble	Messengers	among	you).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	aulād-e-Ya‘qūb yād	karo	mera	ehsān	jo	
maiñ ne	tum	par	kiya	aur	woh	jo	maiñ	ne	us	
zamāne	ke	sab	logoñ	me	tumheiñ	badāi	di	.

arabicText: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ يَوْمًۭا لَّا تَجْزِى نَفْسٌ عَن نَّفْسٍۢ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا يُقْبَلُ مِنْهَا عَدْلٌۭ وَلَا تَنفَعُهَا شَفَـٰعَةٌۭ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 fear	 the	 day	 when	 no	 soul	 will	 be	
exchanged	 for	another,	 nor	will	 they	 be	 set	
free	 in	 lieu	 of	 compensation,	 nor	 will	 any	
intercession	 benefit	 the	 disbelievers,	 nor	
will	they	be	helped
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 daro	 us	 din	 se	 ke	 koi	 jān	 doosre	 ke	
badla	 na	 hogi	 aur na	 usko	 kuch	 lekar	 ke	
chordeiñ	aur	na	kāfir	ko	koi	sifarish	nafa'	de	
aur	na	unki	madad	ho.

arabicText: ۞ وَإِذِ ٱبْتَلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ رَبُّهُۥ بِكَلِمَـٰتٍۢ فَأَتَمَّهُنَّ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّى جَاعِلُكَ لِلنَّاسِ إِمَامًۭا ۖ قَالَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِى ۖ قَالَ لَا يَنَالُ عَهْدِى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 (remember)	 when	 Ibrahim’s	
(Abraham’s)	 Lord	 tested	 him	 in	 some	
matters	and	he	fulfilled	them;	He	said,	“I	am	
going	 to	 appoint	 you	 as	 a	 leader	 for	
mankind”;	 invoked	 Ibrahim,	 “And	 of	 my	
offspring”;	 He	 said,	 “My	 covenant	 does	 not	
include	the	unjust	(wrong-doers).”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 Ibrāheem ko	 uske	 Rab	 ne	 kuch	
bātoñ	 se	 āzmāya	 to	 usne	 woh	 poori	 kar	
dikhāyiñ	 farmāya	 maiñ	 tumheiñ	 logoñ	 ka	
Peshwa	 banāne	 wāla	 huñ	 arz	 ki	 aur	 meri	
aulād	 se	 farmāya	 mera	 ‘ahed	 zālimoñ	 ko	
nahi	pahuñchta

arabicText: وَإِذْ جَعَلْنَا ٱلْبَيْتَ مَثَابَةًۭ لِّلنَّاسِ وَأَمْنًۭا وَٱتَّخِذُوا۟ مِن مَّقَامِ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ مُصَلًّۭى ۖ وَعَهِدْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ أَن طَهِّرَا بَيْتِىَ لِلطَّآئِفِينَ وَٱلْعَـٰكِفِينَ وَٱلرُّكَّعِ ٱلسُّجُودِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 when	 We	 made	 this	 House	
(at	 Mecca)	 a	 recourse	 for	 mankind	 and	 a	
sanctuary;	and	take	the	place	where	Ibrahim	stood,	as	your	place	of	prayer;	and	We	imposed	a	duty	
upon	 Ibrahim	and	 Ismail	(Ishmael),	 to	 fully	purify	My	house	 for	 those	who	go	around	it,	and	 those	
who	stay	in	it	(for	worship),	and	those who	bow	down	and	prostrate	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	Ham	ne	is	ghar	ko	logoñ	ke	
liye	 marja'	 aur	 amān	 banāya	 aur	Ibrāheem
ke	khade	hone	ki	jagah	ko	Namāz	ka	maqām	banāo aur	ham	ne	tākeed	farmāyi	Ibrāheem wa	Ismāeel
ko	ke	mera	ghar	khoob	suthra	karo	tawāf	wāloñ	aur	aitekāf	wāloñ	aur	ruku'	wa sujood	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ رَبِّ ٱجْعَلْ هَـٰذَا بَلَدًا ءَامِنًۭا وَٱرْزُقْ أَهْلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ مَنْ ءَامَنَ مِنْهُم بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ ۖ قَالَ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَأُمَتِّعُهُۥ قَلِيلًۭا ثُمَّ أَضْطَرُّهُۥٓ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	(remember)	when	Ibrahim	prayed,	“My	Lord!	Make	this	city	a	place	of	security	and	bestow	upon	
its	people	various	fruits	as	providence	- for	those	among	them	who	believe	in	Allah and	the	Last	Day	
(of	 Resurrection)”;	 He	 answered,	 “And	 whoever	 disbelieves,	 I	 shall provide	 him	 also	 some	
subsistence	and	then	compel	him	towards	the	punishment	of	fire	(hell);	and	that	is	a	wretched	place	
to	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	arz	ki	Ibrāheem ne	ke	aey	mere	Rab	is	shaher	ko	amān	wāla	karde	aur	uske	rahne	wāloñ	ko	
tarah	tarah	ke	phaloñ	se	rozi	de	jo	in	meiñ	se	Allah	aur	pichle	din	par	Imān	lāyeñ	baratne ko	usey	bhi	
dooñga	phir	usey	azāb-e-dozakh	ki	taraf	majboor	karoñ	ga	aur	wo	bahut	buri	jagah	hai	palatne	ki

arabicText: وَإِذْ يَرْفَعُ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ ٱلْقَوَاعِدَ مِنَ ٱلْبَيْتِ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلُ رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	(remember)	when	 Ibrahim	was	raising	
the	 foundations	 of	 the	 House,	 along	 with	
Ismail;	(saying),	 “Our	 Lord!	 Accept	 it	 from	
us;	indeed	You	only	are	the	All	Hearing,	the	
All	Knowing.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 uthāta	 tha	 Ibrāheem is	 ghar	 ki	
niweiñ	(Buniyādeiñ)	aur	Ismāeel yeh	kahte	
huwe	 ke	 aey	 Rab	 hamāre	 hum	 se	 qabool	
farma	beshak	tu	hi	hai	sunta	jānta.

arabicText: رَبَّنَا وَٱجْعَلْنَا مُسْلِمَيْنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَآ أُمَّةًۭ مُّسْلِمَةًۭ لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
“Our	 Lord!	 And	 make	 us	 submissive	
towards	 you	 and	 from	 our	 offspring	 a	
nation	 obedient	 to	 You	 - and	 show	 us	 the	
ways	of	our	worship,	and	incline	towards	us	
with Your	 mercy;	 indeed	 You	 only	 are	 the	
Most	 Acceptor	 of	 Repentance,	 the	 Most	
Merciful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Rab	 hamāre! Aur	 kar	 hameiñ	 tere	
huzoor	 gardan	 rakhne	 wāla	 aur	 hamāri	
aulād	meiñ	se	ek	Ummat	teri	farmañ	bardār	
aur	 hameiñ	 hamāri	Ibādat	 ke	 qāyede	 bata	
aur	 ham	 par	 apni	 Rahmat	 ke	 sath	 ruju'	
farma	beshak	 tu	hi	hai	bahut	 tauba	qubool	
karne	wāla	maherbān

arabicText: رَبَّنَا وَٱبْعَثْ فِيهِمْ رَسُولًۭا مِّنْهُمْ يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتِكَ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
“Our	Lord!	And	send	 towards	 them	a	Noble	
Messenger,	 from	amongst	 them,	 to	 recite	 to	
them	 Your	 verses,	 and	 to	 instruct	 them	 in	
Your	Book	and	sound	wisdom*,	and	 to	 fully	
purify	 them;	 indeed	 You	 only	 are	 the	
Almighty,	 the	 Wise.”	 (The	 traditions	 of	 the	
Holy	Prophet	– sunnah	and	hadith	– are	called	
wisdom.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Rab	 hamāre	 aur	 bhej	 un	 meiñ	 ek	
Rasool	 unheiñ	 meiñ	 se	 ke	 un	 par	 teri	
āyateiñ	 tilāwat	 farmāye	 aur	 unheñ	 teri	
kitāb	 aur	 pukhta	 ilm	 sikhāye	 aur	 unheñ	
khoob	 suthra	 farma	 de	 beshak	 tu	 hi	 hai	
ghalib	hikmat	wāla.

arabicText: وَمَن يَرْغَبُ عَن مِّلَّةِ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ إِلَّا مَن سَفِهَ نَفْسَهُۥ ۚ وَلَقَدِ ٱصْطَفَيْنَـٰهُ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 who	 will	 renounce	 the	 religion	 of	
Ibrahim	except	him	who	is	a	fool	at	heart?	We	
indeed	chose	him	(Ibrahim)	in	this	world;	and	
indeed	 in	 the	 Hereafter	 he	 is	 among	 those	
worthy	of	being	closest	to	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ibrāheem ke	Deen	se	kaun	muñh	phere	
siwa	 uske	 jo	 dil	 ka	 ahmaq	 hai	 aur	 beshak	
zaroor	 hum	 ne	 duniya	 meiñ	 use	 chun liya	
aur	 beshak	 wo	 Ākhirat	 meiñ	 hamāre	 khās	
qurb	ki	qābliyat	wāloñ	meiñ	hai

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُۥ رَبُّهُۥٓ أَسْلِمْ ۖ قَالَ أَسْلَمْتُ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
When	 his	 Lord	 said	 to	 him,	 “Submit”,	 he	
said,	 “I	 have	 submitted	 to	 the	 Lord	 Of	 The	
Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Jabke	 usse	 uske	 Rab	 ne	 farmāya	 gardan	
rakh	arz	ki	maiñ	ne	gardan	rakhi	us	ke	liye	
jo	Rab	hai	sāre	jahan	ka

arabicText: وَوَصَّىٰ بِهَآ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ بَنِيهِ وَيَعْقُوبُ يَـٰبَنِىَّ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصْطَفَىٰ لَكُمُ ٱلدِّينَ فَلَا تَمُوتُنَّ إِلَّا وَأَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 Ibrahim	willed	 the	same	religion	upon	
his	sons,	and	also	did	Yaqub	(Jacob);	(saying),	“O	my	sons	- indeed	Allah has	chosen	this	religion	
for	you;	therefore	do	not	die	except	as	Muslims	(those	who	submit	to	Him).”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 usi	 Deen	 ki	 wasiyat	 ki	 Ibrāheem ne	
apne	 betoñ	 ko	 aur	 Ya‘qūb ne	 ke	 aey	 mere	
betoñ	 beshak	 Allah	 ne	 yeh	 Deen	 tumhāre	
liye	chun	liya	to	na	marna	magar	Musalman

arabicText: أَمْ كُنتُمْ شُهَدَآءَ إِذْ حَضَرَ يَعْقُوبَ ٱلْمَوْتُ إِذْ قَالَ لِبَنِيهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِنۢ بَعْدِى قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ إِلَـٰهَكَ وَإِلَـٰهَ ءَابَآئِكَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ إِلَـٰهًۭا وَٰحِدًۭا وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. In	fact,	some	of	you	yourselves	were	present	when	death	approached	Yaqub	and	when	he	said	
to	his	sons,	“What	will	you	worship	after	me?”	They	said,	“We	shall	worship	Him	Who	is	your	
God,	and	is	the	God	of	your	fathers,	Ibrahim	and	Ismail	and	Ishaq	(Isaac)	- the	One	God;	and	to	
Him	we	have	submitted	ourselves.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	 tum	 meiñ	 ke	 khud	 maujood	 they	 jab	 Ya‘qūb ko	 maut	 āyi	 jabke	 usne	 apne	 betoñ	 se	
farmāya	mere	bād	kis	ki	pooja	karoge	bole	hum	poojeiñ	ge	usey	jo	Khuda	hai	āp	ka	aur	āp	ke	
wālidoñ	Ibrāheem wa Ismāeel wa Ishāq ka	ek	Khuda	aur	ham	uske	huzoor	gardan	rakhe	haiñ.

arabicText: تِلْكَ أُمَّةٌۭ قَدْ خَلَتْ ۖ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَلَكُم مَّا كَسَبْتُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُسْـَٔلُونَ عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
This	was	a	nation	that	has	passed	away;	 for	them	is	what	they	earned,	and	yours	is	what	you	
earn;	and	you	will	not	be	questioned	about	their	deeds
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	ek	Ummat	hai	ke	guzar	chuki	unke	liye	hai	jo	unhoñ	ne	kamāya	aur	tumhāre	liye	hai	jo	tum	
kamāo	aur	unke	kāmoñ	ki	tumse	pursish	na	hogi

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ كُونُوا۟ هُودًا أَوْ نَصَـٰرَىٰ تَهْتَدُوا۟ ۗ قُلْ بَلْ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ حَنِيفًۭا ۖ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 People	 given	 the	 Book(s)	 said,	
“Become	 Jews	 or	 Christians	 - you	 will	
attain	the	right	path”;	say	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him),	 “No	- rather	we	 take	 the	 religion	of	
Ibrahim,	 who	 was	 far	 removed	 from	 all	
falsehood;	and	was	not	of	the	polytheists.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kitābi	 bole	Yahūdi ya	Nasrāni	 ho	jao	
rāh	 pāo	 ge	 tum	 farmao	 balke	 ham	 to	
Ibrāheem ka	deen	lete	haiñ	jo	har	bātil	se	
juda	they	aur	mushrikoñ	se	na	they

arabicText: قُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْنَا وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَٱلْأَسْبَاطِ وَمَآ أُوتِىَ مُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَمَآ أُوتِىَ ٱلنَّبِيُّونَ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍۢ مِّنْهُمْ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“We	believe	in	Allah and	what	is	sent	
down	 to	 us	 and	 what	 was	 sent	 down	 to	
Ibrahim,	 and	 Ismael,	 and	 Ishaq,	 and	
Yaqub,	 and	 to	 their	 offspring,	 and	 what	
was	 bestowed	 upon	 Moosa	 and	 Eisa	
(Jesus),	 and	 what	 was	 bestowed	 upon	
other	 Prophets	- from	 their	 Lord;	 we	 do	
not	 make	 any	 distinction,	 in	 belief,	
between	 any	 of	 them;	 and	 to	 Allah we	
have	submitted	ourselves.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yuñ	kaho	ke	ham	Imān	lāye	Allah	par	aur	
us	 par	 jo	 hamāri	 taraf	 utra	 aur	 jo	 utāra	
gaya	 Ibrāheem wa Ismāeel wa Ishāq wa
Ya‘qūb aur	unki	aulād	par	aur	jo	ata	 kiye	
gaye	 Mūsā wa ‘Isā aur	 jo	 ata	 kiye	 gaye	
bāqi	Ambiya	apne	Rab	ke	 pās	 se	 hum	 un	
meiñ	 kisi	 par	 Imān	 meiñ	 farq	 nahi	 karte	
aur	 ham	 Allah	 ke	 huzoor	 gardan	 rakhte	
haiñ	.

arabicText: فَإِنْ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِمِثْلِ مَآ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ فَقَدِ ٱهْتَدَوا۟ ۖ وَّإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّمَا هُمْ فِى شِقَاقٍۢ ۖ فَسَيَكْفِيكَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	 if	 they	 believe	 in	 the	 same	 way	 you	
have	 believed,	 they	 have	 attained	
guidance;	and	if	 they	 turn	away,	 they	are	
clearly	being	stubborn;	so	Allah will	soon	
suffice	 you	(O	 dear	 Prophet	Muhammad -
peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 against	
them;	and	He	 only	is	 the	All	Hearing,	 the	
All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 agar	woh	 bhi	 yuñ	 hi	 Imān	lāye	jaisa	
tum	lāye	 jab	 to	 woh	 hidāyat	 pā	 gaye	 aur	
agar	 muñh	 phereiñ	 to	 woh	 niri	 zid	 meiñ	
haiñ	to	aey	Mehboob an-qareeb	Allah	unki	
taraf	 se	 tumheiñ	 kifāyat	 karega	 aur	wohi	
hai	sunta	jānta

arabicText: صِبْغَةَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَمَنْ أَحْسَنُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ صِبْغَةًۭ ۖ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ عَـٰبِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“We	 have	 taken	 the	 colour	 (religion)	 of	
Allah; and	 whose	 colour	 (religion)	 is	
better	than	that	of	Allah?	And	only	Him	do	
we	worship.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hum	ne	Allah	ki	raini (rañgāi) li	aur	Allah	
se	behtar	kis	ki	raini (rañgāi) aur	ham	usi	
ko	poojte	haiñ.

arabicText: قُلْ أَتُحَآجُّونَنَا فِى ٱللَّهِ وَهُوَ رَبُّنَا وَرَبُّكُمْ وَلَنَآ أَعْمَـٰلُنَا وَلَكُمْ أَعْمَـٰلُكُمْ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُخْلِصُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“What!	You	dispute	with	us	
concerning	Allah,	whereas	He	is	our	Lord	and	also	yours?	Our	deeds	are	with us	and	with	you	
are	your	deeds;	and	only	to	Him	do	we	sincerely	belong.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Tum	 farmao	 kya	 Allah	 ke	 bāre	 meiñ	
jhagardte	 ho	 halāñke	 Woh	 hamāra	 bhi	
mālik	hai	aur	 tumhāra	bhi	aur	hamāri	karni	hamāre	sāth	aur	 tumhari	karni	 tumhāre	sāth	aur	
ham	nire	usi	ke	haiñ

arabicText: أَمْ تَقُولُونَ إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَٱلْأَسْبَاطَ كَانُوا۟ هُودًا أَوْ نَصَـٰرَىٰ ۗ قُلْ ءَأَنتُمْ أَعْلَمُ أَمِ ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن كَتَمَ شَهَـٰدَةً عِندَهُۥ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“In	fact	you	claim	that	Ibrahim,	and	Ismail,	and	Ishaq,	and	Yaqub,	and	their	offspring	were	Jews	
or	Christians”;	say,	“Do	you	know	better,	or	does	Allah?”;	and	who	is	more	unjust	than	one	who	
has	the	testimony	from	Allah and	he	hides	it?	And	Allah is	not	unaware	of	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	tum	yuñ kahte	ho	ke	Ibrāheem wa Ismāeel wa Ishāq wa Ya‘qūb aur	unke	bete	Yahūdi	ya	
Nasrāni	they	tum	farmao	kya	tumheiñ	ilm	ziyāda	hai	ya	Allah	ko	aur	usse	badhkar	zālim	kaun	
jis	ke	pās	Allah	ki	taraf	ki	gawāhi	ho	aur	woh	usey	chupāye	aur	Khuda	tumhāre	kautakoñ	(Bure	
a’amāl)	se	be-khabar	nahiñ.

arabicText: تِلْكَ أُمَّةٌۭ قَدْ خَلَتْ ۖ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَلَكُم مَّا كَسَبْتُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُسْـَٔلُونَ عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	were	a	group	that	has	passed	away;	for	them	is	what	they	earned,	and	for	you	is	what	you	
earn;	and	you	will	not	be	questioned	about	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	ek	giroh	 hai	 ke	guzar	gayā	 unke	liye	 unki	 kamāyi	aur	 tumhāre	liye	 tumhāri	 kamāyi	aur	
unke	kāmoñ	ki	tumse	pursish	na	hogi
